section.title: Maneuver
section.para: This was created using the 6-8-2008 build of GMAT.

section.title: Overview
section.para: The Maneuver command is placed in the mission tree and applies a selected impulsive burn to a selected spacecraft. A finite burn requires something else to be applied.

section.title: Listing of Objects and Commands that interact

listitem.para: Item that the Maneuver command applies to the Spacecraft.

section.title: Using the GUI
section.para: There are two boxes. One box is there to select which impulsive burn the user would like to apply to a spacecraft. The other box enables the user to select which spacecraft the impulsive burn will be applied to.

info.title: Figure: Default Name and Settings for the Maneuver Command Dialog Box

caption.para: Figure: Default Name and Settings for the Maneuver Command Dialog Box

entry.para: Options:[ Any impulsive burn existing in the resource tree or created in the script]:

The BurnName field allows the user to choose between any previously created impulsive burn. As an example, to maneuver DefaultSC using DefaultIB, the script line would appear as Manevuer DefaultIB(DefaultSC).
Options:[ Any spacecraft existing in the resource tree or created in the script]:
The SpacecraftName field allows the user to select which spacecraft to maneuver using the maneuver selected in the BurnName field.
